lead_paragraph: A New Jersey police officer who drove the wrong way on a highway had a blood-alcohol level three times the legal limit, the police said.

headline.print_headline: Officer in Fatal Staten Island Crash Was Drunk, Officials Say
headline.main: Off-Duty Officer in Fatal Crash on Staten Island Was Drunk, Officials Say

snippet: A New Jersey police officer who drove the wrong way on a highway had a blood-alcohol level three times the legal limit, the police said.
abstract: Tests show that Pedro Abad, off-duty police officer from Linden, NJ, had blood-alcohol level of .24, three times legal limit, when he drove wrong way and crashed into tractor trailer in Staten Island, killing two of his passengers.
